headline: White Chili with Ground Turkey
description: This white turkey chili with beans and green chiles is seasoned perfectly with garlic, cumin, oregano, and cinnamon for a hearty, flavor-packed meal.
name: White Chili with Ground Turkey
recipeIngredient: 2 (4 ounce) cans canned green chile peppers, chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Combine ground turkey, onion, and garlic in a large pot over medium heat; cook and stir until turkey is browned, about 10 minutes. Add chile peppers, cumin, oregano, cinnamon, cayenne pepper, and white pepper; cook and stir 5 more minutes.

Pour in chicken broth and 2 cans of cannellini beans. Puree the remaining can of beans in a blender or food processor; stir into the soup and add cheese. Simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until cheese has blended into the soup.

review.reviewBody: I added all the ingredients except for the cheese. I came out great. I really like the cinnamon flavor, it's different. My husband and son loved it!
I made this fairly true to recipe- I don't really measure seasonings, etc. Don't skip adding cinnamon, was pleasantly surprised by it
Really, really good! Added Avocado & crushed chips for extra fun! This will be one of our staples.

This recipe surprised me with how good it is! It's much more of a soup than a chili because it doesn't thicken up. But to my surprise, my husband and picky teenage daughters loved it this way, as did I. I served it with toasted and buttered rosemary bread. I used ground chicken because I didn't have ground turkey in my freezer. And, instead of different beans, I used 3 cans of white beans.
We love this recipe and only decrease the broth a bit. Delicious!
Delicious chili using recipe as stated. Wouldn't change a thing. I'll definitely make this again.

I modified the recipe by using a combination of ground turkey & chicken thighs. I omitted the beans due to diverticulitis (for a friend). I used roasted green chilies and halved the recipe due to limited meat on hand.
It's a great and easy no-tomatoes take on chili. I typically omit the cayenne and reduce the cinnamon just a bit. Guests love this.
Added some mexican seasoned rice (Knorr) 5.4 oz..took care of extra broth, thickened and made more...can't have to much of this chili!!!
Delicious and the family enjoyed it as well!
Fabulous recipe. Easy to make and a hit with everyone. I serve it with cornbread. So yummy!
I've made this many times and my family loves it. Great healthy alternative to regular chili.
Made as directed, many times. I love this recipe.
Good but neither my daughter nor I loved it.

I really like this recipe, but as many other commenters noted, the amount of broth is too much for a chili. I typically will add only 3 cups of broth, and then use 4-5 cans of beans. I love the combination of the cumin and cinnamon, and do everything else as noted here.

has fantastic flavor
need to marinate the turkey in a few tablespoons of plain yoghurt for amazing chili

I used the amount of chicken broth as the recipe asked for, and I let it reduce down over an hour to the desired thickness. I didn't use any cheese in the recipe. I didn't have canned chiles but I had a fresh jalapeno that I minced and added instead. It was delicious. I served it with some slices of fresh avocado.
My family loved this chili, I made it exactly by the recipe. We were sad when there were no more left overs!

I have made this recipe for years and love it. But I made changes after makin it so long. I put 2 cans of beans and 4 cups of chicken broth it's soupy but it goes good with the cheese and cornbread in it love it.

I love chili and yet most chili gives me horrible indigestion (same for my mom). We are so so so happy to report that neither of us got indigestion after eating this recipe. The only change was I put just a dash of cayenne and no white pepper. So delicious.
I made it as directed, however instead of mashing the third can of beans I substituted a can of refried beans. Turned out great!

Easy, great taste, good mix of spices and herbs but the 5 cups of chicken stock is an absolute mistake. 2 1/2 to 3 cups might be the way to go next time. I simmered it uncovered for 15 minutes and it was still soupy. Other than that, the recipe is a keeper.

Delicious! So aromatic. Made the whole house smell good. A great hearty fall meal. Used 4 cups reduced sodium chicken broth and it was plenty. Next time will add a little more cayenne pepper (maybe a 1/4 teaspoon) and will add the cheese when serving in bowls instead of in the pot so the pot is not so hard to clean (the cheese sticks). Served with jasmine rice and topped with avocado, sour cream, cilantro, and corn chips (Fritos). Was really delicious! My family loved it. Will make again!

This is a great use-what-you-have recipe because the spices make it come together no matter what! I’ve made this as written a few times but tonight had to change it up to use up what I had and it was just as good. I only had garbanzo beans so added those in when I added the spices so they had a little longer to soften, and it was an excellent substitute. I was also out of chicken broth so used one can of cream of chicken and half a can of cream of celery with one and a half cans of water. I also added a little red and orange pepper and corn, and garnished with fresh parsley. Oh, and I used shredded Parmesan because that was the only cheese I had left. Almost sounds like a new recipe lol! But I swear the spices made it taste quite similar to the original.
This is a soup. Not thick. It still tastes good though. I would suggest cutting the broth to 4 cups or less.

I made with beans I had on hand; butter beans, great Northern beans and the third can I used black-eyed peas and mashed them up. I added 4 cups of chicken broth and it was still not thick enough. So I had to add Wondra to thicken. I also didn’t have chili peppers, so I substituted with what I had on hand which was diced jalapeño peppers. I added some juice along with it and it gave it the same flavor.I also added about a 1/4 cup of vermouth to give it a little more flavor. Of course, the alcohol cooks out.
I made as is and it tasted great!
This is such a good group of ingredients
Love it; adjusted the liquid to my liking!

I made this exactly as it was written and it was FANTASTIC! Mine is more like soup, perhaps because I did include the juice from the beans. The flavor is wonderful - a perfect and filling winter meal!
I made the recipe according to the directions, although I only did half the cinnamon. I’m thinking next time I make this adding sliced up white corn tortillas to it ... turkey tortilla stew!
Delicious. We enjoy this dish a lot.

This was great! My only mistake is I accidentally purchased hot jalapeño green chilies so it made it spicy! I added 1 cup of broth to the puréed beans, it made them smoother. I didn’t add the cheese to the chili, only as a chili topping. I added 2 cups of broth (3 cups total with the puréed beans). I served with avocado, cilantro, green onions and cheese. My husband said it would be good the next day over rice.
Delicious! I made just as stated without the spice.
I love it. Easy to follow recipe and it taste delicious!! Would highly recommend this recipe.

DELICIOUS! My family loved it too. I followed the basic recipe, except I used my leftover Thanksgiving Turkey meat, and I didn't have any chili's so couldn't add them to the pot. I wouldn't add any additional cinnamon or cumin. I did add corn per another followers recommendations, and glad I did.
I have been making this recipe for several years now and it's a big hit. My kids love it and so does the hubs. I bring it to winter time get togethers and get constant compliments. It's tasty.
Delicious! Definitely a keeper
Very quick and very tasty.
I’ve been making this for a few years now. I don’t use cayenne, instead I put some pickled jalapeños in. Gives it a great flavor. Every time the weather gets cold, my family requests it!

The flavors in this chili are incredible! I agree with other reviewers, even if you’re unsure, don’t leave out the cinnamon. It adds to the complexity and takes the recipe to another level. I couldn’t find Monterey Jack cheese, so I used one cup pepper jack and one cup sharp cheddar...still delicious!!

I found a recipe very similar to this through our local H-E-B grocery store Cooking Connection and could not find my recipe. Found this and I am so glad that I did! Very tasty and very close to what I have made before. Big difference for me is...I’m allergic to cinnamon so I do not own any! Thank you for posting it! Delicious!

If you follow the ingredients to the T this is soup, not chili. My boyfriend was very disappointed and we had to jerry-rig last minute to get it to chili-ish consistently. I don’t make a habit of reading the comments, but I should have in this instance, because replacing ingredients negates the point of a recipe.
Didn’t care for the cinnamon and it was really runny.

This was very easy to make and it was ready quickly, two of the things I was looking for on a night when I hadn’t thought about dinner until after I normally eat. I made as written, but did add a little extra cayenne knowing that I prefer things a little spicier. This was absolutely fantastic and if you’re someone who likes to tinker with recipes, this is a great base to start with, but truly, this is just great as it is. One reviewer is right to comment on adjusting the amount of broth based on your preference, but 5 cups does give it a bit of a soupy texture but I was fine with that as well. Great stuff and can’t wait to make a lot of this over the winter!

omg
This turned out LOVELY! I used hatch chilis and the juice from one can that added so much flavor. It tasted even better the next day as it had time to marinate! This is the first soup I have ever made!! Thanks for the recipe!!

Great alternate chili recipe. Use less broth and add more puréed beans to thicken it, make it more filling at not cost to flavor.
Add some heat with Serrano pepper.
Only change I made was to use ground chicken instead of turkey. This is a very tasty recipe. I have made this chili numerous times, always a big hit with everyone!

I liked it . 2/3 of my adult kids thought it needed more spice. I think it would taste good with about 50% more of the spices. My husband likes his food on the bland side. I saved this and will make it again. It’s more of a soup so reduce liquid if you want a chili.
Very Tasty soup
we desperately needed something different for dinner. my husband a bit picky and he loved it!!! it was super easy and I'm not much for cooking
Very good flavor! Will be making this one again! I left out the cinnamon because it didn't sound good, but will add at least some of it next time at our son's request.

I used small white beans and diced turkey instead of ground. I only used 4 cups of chicken broth and let in simmer to reduce the liquid. I only used one can of chiles but added 2 diced and sauteed jalapeños. My husband likes it.
Made it a few nights ago. I gave it only 3 stars . I guess I like my old Hamburg chili better.

This was delicious! I only used 4 cups of broth and let it cook down about 20 minutes. We omitted the onion due to an allergy. I did use the cinnamon and you can hardly taste it, but it does add a layer of flavor. Will continue to use it. The family loved it! We ate it with tortilla chips.

Absolutely five stars after a few modifications. Used a few chopped jalapeños instead of canned cold peppers. Did not add any cheese to the soup. Added some halved grape tomatoes in the last 10 minutes. Served with a sprinkling of shredded cheese, a dollop of sour cream, and freshly chopped cilantro. Don't forget the spicy cornbread...
Super tasty! I had leftover turkey from thanksgiving in the freezer, so just cubed it up and threw it in there. Great flavor, texture, & super easy! I’ll make this again for sure.

I think the idea was sound , but as is it is a nice soup . To make it more chili like cut the broth in half used one can green chili and one fresh green pepper that was cooked after onion I took out the cinnamon and substituted Cholula green pepper hot sauce and added a Tablespoon of chili powder . The word chili does not mean the same thing everywhere
My hubs & I didn’t care for the cinnamon flavor at all. We typically love cinnamon, but a cinnamon flavored chili was not for us. Sorry! (& that was after cutting the cinnamon in half)
It's delicious. I left the cheese out and used as a topping to reduce the fat. So then it's more a soup than a chili. Next time I will add the broth at the end, only if it's too thick.
make all the time my fav i make it with jasmine rice on the side

this was an awesome recipe as a student in Culinary school I had to make a Chili that was white with ground turkey and I had to have white beans and use cranberries. if you add cranberries add them to the end it helps cut the spicy but if you add to early its not as good. this was a competition and I was the only one not a Chef. out of 100 votes I was second place with 40 the first place had 41, the other 19 votes were spread between the three other Chefs. Guess I can't complain I kicked three Chefs butts in this competition, this is a good recipe

This recipe is very adaptable and so delicious! The first time I made it, the cinnamon was way too much so now I only put in about 1/4 of it or none at all. I have made this with leftover diced turkey or chicken with great results and have also added a can of hominy which adds great texture. Serve with tortilla chips!
Tasty and easy. Good over rice.
Liked the flavors. I only put in 4c of broth and still wwwaaaayyyy too much liquid. Before I added the cheese I brought it to boiling then simmered until the liquid reduced by half.
Hubby and I loved it. Made it in the instapot. Added kale. Made a smaller batch so modified ingredients. Topped with all kinds of goodies.

Delicious! I actually added 8 cups of chicken stock and let it reduce down for 45 minutes and it was thick and yummy! I didn’t add the cheese to cut down on calories and fat and only added 1/2 tsp of cinnamon and increased the pepper and cayenne because we love spicy but it was perfect! Will definitely make again!
Super easy to make tastes wonderful love this recipe will make again!!

This was a yummy chili! The spices give it wonderful flavor. I added extra cumin and white pepper, and some Penzey's vindaloo seasoning as I am out of cayenne right now. I prefer a thicker chili so might play around with that next time, but my family loved it as is! Served with jalapeño corn bread.
Modifications that I use when preparing this recipe include:

Oh my yes!!! This is really, really good, and in my red chili loving family a real surprise. I made it with hot pork sausage for extra depth of flavor, and for goodness sake, don't leave out the pinch of cinnamon. I know, strange, but trust the other 980 of us, you won't taste it but will appreciate it. Mine was made with dry beans, pressure cooked for 30 minutes, then added the broth, veggies and chilies. I added a small can of green chilis and at first it was really spicy, but settled down after about 6 hours in the crock pot. Served with monterey jack cheese and fritos, we have dinner!!!!
I have made this several times, sometimes taking out the garlic and onions for guests with food allergies and it is always a hit. I also subtract the cheese just to lower the calorie count a bit.

I will definitely make this again. I needed a gluten free, dairy free option for dinner and this worked perfectly. The people who like dairy can add cheese at the end. I did cut the cinnamon and I used much less of the chicken broth. Vey good!

It was delish! I highly recommend this recipe. Of course adjust it to your liking. Mine came out a bit soupy but I know that I used more broth than needed. I added a little cornstarch water mixture. It helped a little. Thank you!

This recipe is super easy and practical to make. I made it at school for our Thanksgiving lunch. Everybody loved it! I am, definitely, making it again for my family. I actually did save a cup of the chili for my daughter and she asked me to please make some at home. I love easy and yummy recipes and this one is a winner.
I loved this recipe. The cinnamon flavor mixed with the other spices gave it a very nice touch!
Easy recipe to follow. Warm and delicious on a cool football Sunday!
Great flavor from spice mix.

I made this several years ago and forgot about it. It is still as delicious as it was the last time. I make it exactly as stated with one change, I only put in 32 oz of chicken STOCK. I also allow the liquid to softly boil down a bit (a good half hour) before adding the can of beans that have been through the food processor which gives it the perfect consistency, not too much liquid! Excellent recipe.
This chili is delicious! I did cut the cinnamon measurement in half so that it was not overpowering.
Love this, made it it ground chicken and white beans... Delicious and simple
So good

I tried to make this as close to the original recipe as I could. Honest I tried. I sadly only had two cans of white kidney beans & so I sub. 1 can chick peas, used can of Guinness (it would have been a crime not too and its preference of mine in chilli just adds a richness to the dish.) I used fresh green chili's and a pablano pepper. what I had to work with on the chillis. 
I wish I had some white pepper it would have really elevated the whole thing. don't skip out on this or the cinnamon. doesn't seem like it makes a difference but seem to me that would have made this a WOW dish instead of Very Good-great.
My family devoured it. thanks for the recipe. will make again.
Added jalapeños with the green chilis and reduced the broth to only 3 cups. Might need to thicken depending on tastes. Great chili. Works with good cheddar too.
I like it better without the cinnamon. We also like to put quesadilla cheese blend on it.
Used vegetable broth,

Not to be the typical - I made it but I made a million changes person. I made it but I made a million changes. I left the cheese out of the chili and used a habanero jack and feta for garnish. I also cut down on the chicken stock - about 4 cups - and then brought the chili to a boil and reduced to simmer until it reduced a bit (about 20-25 min). I doubled the amount of fresh garlic, doubled the spices that were called for, and added ground cilantro, onion powder, garlic powder, and agave nectar. Garnished with fresh cilantro. It's fantastic!
I love this chili! Comes out great every time.

We make this all the time. For school/sport nights, it can also be done in the croc-pot ahead of time. My entire family loves it! I use ground chicken instead of turkey (I like it better) and we add corn (my son loves it). Other than that, we pretty much make it according to the recipe! Absolutely wonderful! Thank you for the recipe.

AMAZING Recipe!!! This is a perfect soup for summer and winter. 

Super easy to make and very easy to customize to your likings. The base for this soup allows for a LOT of flexibility.

Definitely, definitely going to be making this again and again and again. 

You have to try it!!!
I added a can of black beans, drained, to add a bit of color and it tasted great!
It was delicious. I didn’t use as much of the hot spices just in case. It was delicious but may add more next time.
Family loved it....two bowls a piece with cornbread
Great recipe. Definitely better on day 2.
Tastes Great. I changed the serving size t o 4 and it turned out good.
I made this and added extra chili powder. I would probably reduce the amount of cinnamon next time but my hubby loved it!

This was yummy.
I made this close to the given directions. I scaled down to 4 persons. The recipe then calls for 3/4 lbs meat and 1 1/2 cans beans. I used the whole lb meat, and added 1 1/2 cans beans and puréed the remaining half. I also took other members suggestions and added chicken broth to come out the way our family likes chili.
We had crushed up tortilla chips with it and it was delicious. Will definitely make again. Thanks for sharing. :)

This was yummy.
I made this close to the given directions. I scaled down to 4 persons. The recipe then calls for 3/4 lbs meat and 1 1/2 cans beans. I used the whole lb meat, and added 1 1/2 cans beans and puréed the remaining half. I also took other members suggestions and added chicken broth to come out the way our family likes chili.
We had crushed up tortilla chips with it and it was delicious. Will definitely make again. Thanks for sharing. :)

I made this and let me tell you it is amazing. I followed the recipe, but as others mentioned, I only had 1 pund packages of ground turkey, so I used 2 packages. I reduced the cinnamon to 1/4 tsp, increased all the others to taste, especially garlic. I drained the beans and on carton (4 cups) of chicken broth. Wish I would not have drained the beans I pureed, due to lack of thickness. I felt it needed more salt so I added garlic salt to taste. Served with crushed tortilla chips, sour cream, green onions and cheese. with corn bread. Turned out to be very good!!
